title: Advanced Psychological Practice
description: This module provides training in advanced intervention strategies utilised in clinical psychology. It builds on foundation-level knowledge gained in previous clinical modules, e.g. Psychological Intervention and Therapy (PLC5004). Students will become familiar with current developments in evidence-based psychological therapies, with particular focus on complex, severe, enduring, and acute presentations of mental ill-health, such as psychosis, personality disorders, bipolar affective disorder, and complex PTSD. A wide repertoire of empirically grounded specialist treatment models will be introduced, including, but not limited to, CBT and Family Intervention for psychosis (CBTp, FIp), Metacognitive Therapy (MCT), Dialectic Behaviour Therapy (DBT), and Narrative Exposure Therapy (NET).
prerequisite:
PLC5011A (Clinical Placement 1)
PLC5002 (Adult Psychopathology)
PLC5004 (Psychological Intervention and Therapy)
